snippet: A police official said migrants who pried open a truck door and escaped were apparently taken to Western Europe by the same smugglers as the migrants who died.
abstract: Austrian police say same group of smugglers responsible for deaths of 71 migrants abandoned in locked truck off Austrian highway are behind abandonment of another truck one day later; in second incident, all 81 refugees were able to escape locked vehicle; six smugglers have been arrested.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: A police official said migrants who pried open a truck door and escaped were apparently taken to Western Europe by the same smugglers as the migrants who died.

headline.main: A Day After 71 Migrants Died, 81 Escaped the Back of a Truck in Austria
headline.print_headline: Day After 71 Migrants Died, 81 Escaped From Different Truck in Austria

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
